column2: RI DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Rhode Island

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 2. Distracted driving:
column4: is only dangerous for inexperienced drivers.
column8: usually causes the driver to drive slower.
column10: causes the driver to react more slowly to hazards.

column2: 3. The best way to avoid loss of control in wet conditions is pump your brakes.
column4: False

column2: 4. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column6: to keep the front wheels straight.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: in the opposite direction of the skid.

column2: 5. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there's an intersection ahead.
column10: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 7. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column4: if you dont feel drowsy.
column8: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 8. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column4: adjust your seat belt.
column8: check your rear view mirror.
column10: adjust the steering wheel.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column6: Two roads join from the left
column8: All traffic must turn right
column10: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 10. On a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, you approach an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its warning lights on. You must:
column4: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column6: slow down. If possible, change lanes.
column8: maintain your current speed and stay in your lane.
column10: pass the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: You must travel at the speed indicated
column6: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions
column8: You must not travel below the speed indicated
column10: None of the above

column2: 12. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Law
column8: Guides
column10: Warnings

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Limited parking
column8: One Way
column10: Railroad Crossing

column2: 14. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian.
column8: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.
column10: to the pedestrian.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column8: Stay on the main highway if possible
column10: Not enter

column2: 16. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column6: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column8: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column10: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.

column2: 17. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: after you enter the crosswalk.
column8: before the traffic light turns red.
column10: before you enter the intersection.

column2: 18. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must cross the intersection immdiately.
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.
column10: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 19. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: waterplaning.
column8: rideplaning.
column10: pavement-planing.

column2: 20. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 21. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column6: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column8: always stop.
column10: speed up to beat the train.

column2: 22. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull the steering wheel back.
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 23. If a vehicle starts to skid on water the driver should quickly apply the brakes.
column4: False

column2: 24. A defensive driver:
column4: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column6: never drives below the speed limit.
column8: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.

column2: 25. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column6: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: Turn on your emergency lights.
column10: All of the above.
